answers.answer: To enroll a child in school, first contact the County Schools Inspectorates. Then, fill in the application for enrolling the child in school with the audiences statute and submit it. Finally, the application will be analyzed within one day, and you will decide with a Commission where the child will be assigned.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'I want to enroll my child in school'.

answers.answer: To enroll a child in extracurricular activities, first contact the County Schools Inspectorates. Then, fill in the application without needing the status of audience and submit it. Within one day, the application will be analyzed, and a Commission will contact you to decide where your child will be assigned.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'I want to enroll my child in extracurricular activities'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian children can benefit from psycho-pedagogical assistance and counseling by checking the corresponding option on the application form when enrolling in school or extracurricular activities.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the sections under 'I want to enroll my child in school' or 'I want to enroll my child in extracurricular activities'.

answers.answer: For Ukrainian children who want to learn Romanian, the County School Inspectorates will create the necessary conditions and assure the appropriate human resource for the request.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'I want to enroll my child in extracurricular activities'.

answers.answer: An application for school enrollment will be analyzed within one day since its submission.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'I want to enroll my child in school'.

answers.answer: Students from Ukraine can continue their studies by going directly to the university where they wish to enroll. They can enroll based on a statement on their own responsibility regarding previous studies, even without documents, but must present diplomas proving access to the study cycle before completing their studies.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Continuing your studies'.

answers.answer: To obtain equivalence or recognition of studies, one must contact CNRED (National Center for Diploma Recognition and Equivalence). The process involves setting up a file with required documents, submitting it online, physically, or by mail, and then receiving the certificate.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'I have completed my studies'.

answers.answer: To set up a file for study recognition, you need an application (if submitting physically), a copy of your high school diploma/certificate and school situation for the last two years (with certified translations if not in specified languages), a copy of personal identification documents, and an evaluation fee (unless exempt). Depending on the country, documents may need to be apostille or superlegalized.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Steps you need to follow'.

answers.answer: After submitting a complete file for study recognition, a response from CNRED can be expected within a maximum of 30 working days from the date of registration, though the deadline may be extended if further checks are required.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'What's next?'.

answers.answer: The certificate of study recognition can be obtained in electronic format through the PCUe platform for online submissions, from the university's headquarters, from CNRED headquarters, by post, or by express courier with payment at destination.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Step 3: Take your certificate'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian minors under temporary protection in Romania are eligible for free accommodation in school dormitories, a daily food allowance, and additional financial support for school supplies, bedding, clothing, and footwear.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Accommodation and Allowances for Ukrainian Minors'.

answers.answer: Information available includes details about Ukrainian online or part-time kindergartens, Ukrainian schools and classes in various Romanian cities, options for continuing education remotely, various learning platforms, and free education in private schools in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Ukrainian schools and kindergartens in Romania'.

answers.answer: Free courses and activities offered for Ukrainian refugees, both adults and children, in Romania include language courses, yoga, drawing classes, chess, and music.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Courses and activities for refugees from Ukraine'.

answers.answer: The calendar of holidays for schools and kindergartens in Romania includes the structure of the 2024-2025 school year and a list of days off in Romanian educational institutions.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Calendar of holidays in schools and kindergartens in Romania'.

answers.answer: For inquiries regarding the enrollment and integration process, one can contact Maricica Ciubara, the advisor for Ukrainian students at the Bucharest School Inspectorate (ISMB), at +40799626330 during working hours from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Assistance in the integration of Ukrainian children into the Romanian education system'.
